g.text: UML Diagram: Class Activity in Context
- Move the mouse cursor over a name to see more information.
- Click on a name to go to the corresponding page.
- The arrows of the inheritance tree are

a.title: ― ControlLogic: Control logic is a program in which the order of statements is explicit. Control logic is either deterministic (imperative) or non-deterministic (declarative). Deterministic control logic consists of control constructs. Declarative control logic is constraint- and/or rule-based. Control logic may co ...
a.xlink:title: ― ControlLogic: Control logic is a program in which the order of statements is explicit. Control logic is either deterministic (imperative) or non-deterministic (declarative). Deterministic control logic consists of control constructs. Declarative control logic is constraint- and/or rule-based. Control logic may co ...

a.title: ― ProcessingAgent: A processing agent orchestrates the production of information objects in a production environment. There are processing agents which perform data capture, data editing/processing, and data analysis (etc.), each in the appropriate production environments. The processing agent performs an activity bas ...
a.xlink:title: ― ProcessingAgent: A processing agent orchestrates the production of information objects in a production environment. There are processing agents which perform data capture, data editing/processing, and data analysis (etc.), each in the appropriate production environments. The processing agent performs an activity bas ...

a.title: ― Step: Step is a reusable, parameterized activity associated to information flows. One or more steps perform an sctivity.
a.xlink:title: ― Step: Step is a reusable, parameterized activity associated to information flows. One or more steps perform an sctivity.

a.title: ― Activity: Something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities. (See the W3C PROV-O ontology, https://www.w3.org/TR/prov-dm/#term-Activity)
a.xlink:title: ― Activity: Something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities. (See the W3C PROV-O ontology, https://www.w3.org/TR/prov-dm/#term-Activity)

a.title: ― Reference: Provides a way of pointing to resources outside of the information described in the set of DDI-CDI metadata.
a.xlink:title: ― Reference: Provides a way of pointing to resources outside of the information described in the set of DDI-CDI metadata.

a.title: ― Reference: Provides a way of pointing to resources outside of the information described in the set of DDI-CDI metadata.
a.xlink:title: ― Reference: Provides a way of pointing to resources outside of the information described in the set of DDI-CDI metadata.

a.title: ― Identifier: Identifier for objects requiring short- or long-lasting referencing and management.
a.xlink:title: ― Identifier: Identifier for objects requiring short- or long-lasting referencing and management.

a.title: ― ObjectName: A standard means of expressing a name for a class object. A linguistic signifier. Human understandable name (word, phrase, or mnemonic) that reflects the ISO/IEC 11179-5 naming principles.
a.xlink:title: ― ObjectName: A standard means of expressing a name for a class object. A linguistic signifier. Human understandable name (word, phrase, or mnemonic) that reflects the ISO/IEC 11179-5 naming principles.

a.title: ― Reference: Provides a way of pointing to resources outside of the information described in the set of DDI-CDI metadata.
a.xlink:title: ― Reference: Provides a way of pointing to resources outside of the information described in the set of DDI-CDI metadata.

a.title: ― has: Activities may be broken out into Steps. Steps are also a subtype of Activity.
a.xlink:title: ― has: Activities may be broken out into Steps. Steps are also a subtype of Activity.

a.title: ― hasInternal: An activity is embedded in the control construct which launches it.
a.xlink:title: ― hasInternal: An activity is embedded in the control construct which launches it.

a.title: ― invokes: Control logic invokes an activity deterministically (either conditionally or unconditionally) or non-derministically (based on temporal constraints or rule-based scheduling).
a.xlink:title: ― invokes: Control logic invokes an activity deterministically (either conditionally or unconditionally) or non-derministically (based on temporal constraints or rule-based scheduling).

a.title: ― hasSubActivity: An Activity is a container for SubActivities.
a.xlink:title: ― hasSubActivity: An Activity is a container for SubActivities.

a.title: ― performs: A processing agent performs an activity at the direction of control logic.
a.xlink:title: ― performs: A processing agent performs an activity at the direction of control logic.
